p: Known as the legume family, this is a group of plants commonly found in vegetable gardens worldwide. Among the most commercially important legumes are lentils, peas, chickpeas, soy, and forage crops such as alfalfa and clover. With approximately 20,000 species and more than 700 genera, it is the third-largest plant family and its members can be found worldwide (except in polar regions), being especially diverse in the tropics. Herbs to trees commonly with nitrogen-fixing bacteria nodules on the roots. Some species (clover, alfalfa, etc.) are often used in crop rotation because they increase soil nitrogen.
